channel.title: Snake 2
channel.description:
I have just finished a game i've been working on for a while now. It's name is snake 2. If you've got a few spare minutes or if you are bored please try my new game and report any glitches. :D
http://school.lesterknome.org/snake2.php

item.description:
@system wrote:

yo lester, can you make a swf player for your proxy, or else youtube wont work, n33b and your proxy is magically not (yet) blocked by my school
[/quote]maybe because your school just uses a large database of blacklisted proxies and lesterknome’s is just a private one which isnt listed…[/quote]
na, they prolly search for keywords n shit cause lordbost’s is blocked

item.title: Snake 2
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

if clearing the whole off-screen image takes 3 minutes, you need to rethink your buffer design

Read full topic

item.title: Snake 2
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:8, topic:334326”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=430730.msg3162827#msg3162827 date=1269729893]

yea, instead of drawing the path of the snake white, redraw the entire canvas white

Not the best idea because it takes to much time to repaint the points and etc (like about 3 minutes). It currently just erases the tail when it moves
[/quote]
I assume you’re using a buffered image then. Good work on tracking where it is rather than using some pixel based method (I assume).

Before the game starts use setBackground (like the bank said) then clearRect. Also: 3mins is INSANE. surely you aren’t using setPixel when you should be using fillRect?[/quote]

i already am using setBackround, as you said, also here is my method for drawing the snake:

    public void drawRect(Graphics g, int x, int y, Color color) {
        Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) g;
        g2.setPaint(color);
        g2.fill(new Rectangle2D.Double(x, y, 8, 8));
    }

If you want i could just post all of the source.

I’ll try clearing the whole background before drawing and see if that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Snake 2
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:5, topic:334326”][quote author=Nueb35 link=topic=430730.msg3162469#msg3162469 date=1269707454]
yea, instead of drawing the path of the snake white, redraw the entire canvas white
[/quote]
Not the best idea because it takes to much time to repaint the points and etc (like about 3 minutes). It currently just erases the tail when it moves[/quote]
I assume you’re using a buffered image then. Good work on tracking where it is rather than using some pixel based method (I assume).

Before the game starts use setBackground (like the bank said) then clearRect. Also: 3mins is INSANE. surely you aren’t using setPixel when you should be using fillRect?

Read full topic

item.title: Snake 2
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:5, topic:334326”][quote author=Nueb35 link=topic=430730.msg3162469#msg3162469 date=1269707454]
yea, instead of drawing the path of the snake white, redraw the entire canvas white
[/quote]

Not the best idea because it takes to much time to repaint the points and etc (like about 3 minutes). It currently just erases the tail when it moves

Work on the controls I found them to not be accurate enough.

How so?

I am currently working on the repaint glitch, hopefully it will be fixed soon[/quote]

holy crap :0 3 minutes? how are you doing it?

Read full topic

item.title: Snake 2
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

Nueb35:

yea, instead of drawing the path of the snake white, redraw the entire canvas white

Not the best idea because it takes to much time to repaint the points and etc (like about 3 minutes). It currently just erases the tail when it moves

Miss Silabsoft:

Work on the controls I found them to not be accurate enough.

How so?

I am currently working on the repaint glitch, hopefully it will be fixed soon
